{% extends "_layouts/skeleton.html" %} {% set content %} # Assets template reference You can access the [assets]({{ pt.pages.getUrlById('assets') }}) methods in your site via the `pt.assets` variable. ## Available methods

pt.assets.getUrl(relPath)

Gets the full URL of an asset, specified by it's assets-directory (/assets) relative path.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Depending on the kind of asset requested from this URL, it may trigger some specific behaviour - for instance requesting the URL for a LESS file will result in the processed CSS being returned, along with the appropriate MIME type headers set. See the assets docs for more information.

pt.assets.getUrlPath(relPath)

Gets the root-relative URL of an asset, specified by it's assets-directory (/assets) relative path.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Depending on the kind of asset requested from this URL, it may trigger some specific behaviour - for instance requesting the URL for a LESS file will result in the processed CSS being returned, along with the appropriate MIME type headers set. See the assets docs for more information.

pt.assets.getFileUrl(relPath)

Gets the full URL of an file, specified by it's file-directory (/files) relative path.

{% raw %}
Download now!
{% endraw %}

pt.assets.getFileUrlPath(relPath)

Gets the root-relative URL of an file, specified by it's file-directory (/files) relative path.
